content: small eggdog by chai latte materials needed ● 16 - 21 yds worsted weight for a ~3in plush ● 2 5 - 3 5mm hook ● yarn needle ● scissors abbreviations ● round round ● chain chain ● single_crochet single_crochet ● increase increase ● decrease decrease instructions body round 1 make a magic_ring 6 single_crochet in the circle 6 sts round 2 increase in each st around 12 sts round 3 single_crochet in the next st increase repeat around 18 sts round 4 single_crochet in the next 2 sts increase repeat around 24 sts round 5 single_crochet in the next 10 sts increase 3 times single_crochet in the next 11 sts 27 sts round 6 single_crochet in the next 10 sts decrease 3 times single_crochet in the next 11 sts 24 sts round 7-11 single_crochet in each st around 24 sts round 12 single_crochet in the next 2 sts decrease repeat around 18 sts round 13 single_crochet in the next st decrease repeat around 12 sts start stuffing the egg shape with fiberfill continue stuffing as you go round 14 decrease around 6 sts if needed add more stuffing cut yarn leaving a long tail thread the tail through a yarn needle and weave through the remaining 6 sts pull tight to close knot and hide the tail inside the egg use needle sculpting to pull in the corners of the top bottom left and right edges of the muzzle this creates more of a pronounced snout legs foundation chain chain 3 round 1 starting from the 2nd chain from hook single_crochet in the next chain make 3 single_crochet in the last chain this will turn your work around to the other side of the chain single_crochet in the next chain on the other side of the chain make 2 single_crochet in the last chain which is the first chain you worked into 7 sts round 2 now working in rounds single_crochet in each st around 7 sts round 3 working in the front loops only flo single_crochet in each st around 7 sts round 4 continuing in the front loops only flo single_crochet in each st around 7 sts cut yarn leaving a long tail for sewing do not stuff the leg round 5 flatten the top of the leg aligning the stitches on the front and back using the yarn needle and the long tail sew through both layers of stitches across the top to close the leg assembly 1 position the legs at the bottom of the egg body ensuring they are evenly spaced 2 using the yarn needle and the long tail from each leg sew the legs to the body securely 3 embroider two diagonal lines just above the muzzle with one space in between the nose is also just a line two stitches long in the center of the muzzle the mouth is a line below the nose four stitches long
